title: Syllabus mentioned in ERP
text: Prerequisite: NoneManaging Business in the Digital World: Introduction, How IT has changed the concepts of traditional MIS with examples and case studies. Basic understanding of e-business building blocks, Emerging e-Business models ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ B2B, B2C, C2C etc., Case-studies on e-auctions, electronic markets, electronic procurement, automated supply chains, e-marketing, e-customer relationship management, e-finance systems, and negotiations support systems.Evaluation of E-Business Infrastructure and Capacity Planning: Quantitative analysis of authentication and payment services, Capacity planning methodologies, Performance models for e-business sites, Modelling web-server workload.Techniques for Achieving Competitive Advantage: Collecting userbehaviour data, Web mining, user modelling, Recommender and personalisation systems, Website design benchmarking and usability, Dynamic pricing, Software agents, Web services, Web matrices.Mathematical Models for E-Business Systems: Online auctions: Types of auctions ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ English auctions, sealed-bid auctions, reverse auctions, and double auctions, Game theoretic models for auctions.
